intro: Racosperma ashbyae, commonly known as Ashby's wattle, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as spinifex plains. Its leaves are bipinnate, consisting of multiple pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Racosperma ashbyae is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid environments.
